alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 7:28PM CST until February 18 at 2:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, St. Clair. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 728 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pell City, Leeds, Moody, Rainbow City, Springville, Odenville, Lincoln, Margaret, Argo, Ashville, Riverside, Vincent, Ragland, Ohatchee, Steele, Harrisburg, Branchville, Bald Rock, Logan Martin Lake and Coosa Island.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
